author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period has elapsed.

---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Really not sure what the error is. It's working fine on Windows and WSL Ubuntu.

[noblock]

[noblock]

https://github.com/xiaodaigh/JLBoostmlj.jl/blob/master/src/JLBoostMLJ.jl

The issue is that if you want the package to be named `JLBoostmlj.jl`, then the file needs to be named `src/JLBoostmlj.jl`. Linux is a case-sensitive operating system.

But personally, I think that the name `JLBoostMLJ` is better than `JLBoostmlj`. If you want to rename your package back to `JLBoostMLJ`, I’ll manually merge it after the 3 day waiting period.

JLBoostMLJ was the first name, but then having capital letters is not recommended

[noblock]

Ah, it's already renamed to lower case but when pushed that doesn't get registered. So I renamed it on github.

[noblock]

> JLBoostMLJ was the first name, but then having capital letters is not recommended
> 
> [noblock]

The message from the bot might be misleading. It is fine to have capital letters - it just means that a human needs to approve it the first time. I can do that approval.

> The message from the bot might be misleading. It is fine to have capital letters - it just means that a human needs to approve it the first time. I can do that approval.

Ok. I will rename it then. JLBoostMLJ is easier to remember and better looking to me.

> > The message from the bot might be misleading. It is fine to have capital letters - it just means that a human needs to approve it the first time. I can do that approval.
> 
> Ok. I will rename it then. JLBoostMLJ is easier to remember and better looking to me.

I agree. I’ll close this PR, and then you can make a new registration as JLBoostMLJ.
